lessons.title: Understanding Passages
lessons.content: Learn how to read passages carefully to understand the main idea, details, and context.

examples.problem: Passage: 'The sun rises in the east.' What is the main idea?
solution: The sun rises in a particular direction, east

examples.problem: Passage: 'Many birds migrate in winter.' What detail supports this?
solution: Birds travel to warmer areas during winter

quiz.text: What is the main idea of: 'Cats are playful animals.'
Detail: 'She wore a red dress and a hat.' What color is the dress?
Infer: 'He ran to catch the bus.' What can you infer?
Main idea: 'Rainfall helps plants grow.'
Detail: 'The cat slept on the sofa all day.' Where did the cat sleep?
Infer: 'She studied all night.' What can you infer?
Main idea: 'Recycling reduces waste.'
Detail: 'He ate an apple and a banana.' Which fruits did he eat?
Infer: 'She wore sunglasses.' What can you infer?
Main idea: 'Dogs are loyal pets.'

lessons.title: Main Idea & Details
lessons.content: Learn how to identify the main idea and supporting details in a passage.

examples.problem: Passage: 'Many students enjoy sports.' Main idea?
Supporting detail: 'Football, basketball, and tennis are popular.'

quiz.text: Main idea: 'Rain helps plants grow.'
Supporting detail: 'She wore a red dress.'
Main idea: 'Birds migrate in winter.'
Supporting detail: 'The dog barked loudly.'
Main idea: 'Exercise keeps us healthy.'
Supporting detail: 'He runs every morning.'
Main idea: 'Trees provide shade.'
Supporting detail: 'The tree is big.'
Main idea: 'Reading improves knowledge.'
Supporting detail: 'He reads every evening.'

lessons.title: Inference & Prediction
lessons.content: Learn how to make logical guesses (inferences) and predict what happens next in a passage.

examples.problem: Sentence: 'He packed an umbrella.' What can you infer?
Predict: 'She opened the gift.' What will she do?

quiz.text: Infer: 'Clouds are dark.'
Predict: 'He studied hard.'
Infer: 'The ground is wet.'
Predict: 'She smiled happily.'
Infer: 'The boy wore a coat.'
Predict: 'He packed his bag.'
Infer: 'Smoke rises from chimney.'
Predict: 'She opened her notebook.'
Infer: 'He is shivering.'
Predict: 'The team huddled together.'

lessons.title: Summarizing
lessons.content: Learn to write brief summaries capturing the main idea and key details of a passage.

examples.problem: Passage: 'Dogs bark, cats meow, and birds chirp.'
solution: Summary: Different animals make different sounds

examples.problem: Passage: 'She likes reading books every day.'

quiz.text: Summarize: 'The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.'
Summarize: 'The boy ate an apple and a banana.'
Summarize: 'She studied all night for the test.'
Summarize: 'Birds migrate during winter.'
Summarize: 'He cleaned his room and washed dishes.'
Summarize: 'Rain helps plants grow.'
Summarize: 'The teacher explained the lesson and gave homework.'
Summarize: 'He drank water and ate food.'
Summarize: 'She smiled and waved at her friend.'
Summarize: 'The children played football and basketball.'

lessons.title: Answering Questions from Texts
lessons.content: Learn how to answer comprehension questions based on a given passage, focusing on details and inference.

examples.problem: Passage: 'Dogs bark at strangers to protect their home.' Question: 'Why do dogs bark at strangers?'
Passage: 'The sun rises in the east.' Question: 'Where does the sun rise?'

quiz.text: Passage: 'The sun rises in the east.' Question: Where does it rise?
Passage: 'Birds fly in the sky.' Question: What do birds do?
Passage: 'He drank water.' Question: What did he drink?
Passage: 'She read a book.' Question: What did she read?
Passage: 'It rained heavily.' Question: What happened?
Passage: 'The boy plays football.' Question: What sport?
Passage: 'She sang beautifully.' Question: How did she sing?
Passage: 'He is tall.' Question: How is he?
Passage: 'Dogs bark at strangers.' Question: Who barks?
Passage: 'She smiled and waved.' Question: What did she do?
